title.narrative: OUTPUT 2: POLICY TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

description.narrative: By 2022, provincial and territory governments and other stakeholders have new evidence to inform policy options to address child labour, violence and exploitation

title.narrative: Pakistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Pakistan Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Child Protection)
UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Pakistan: End of Programme Evaluation on Promoting Child Rights in Cotton Farming Areas (CRCFA) Programme of Pakistan
2019 Pakistan: Reach Every District (RED)/Reach Every Community (REC) Strategy Evaluation Pakistan (2014-18)
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, provincial and territory governments and other stakeholders have new evidence to inform policy options to address child labour, violence and exploitation

description.narrative: The national child labour survey was launched and underway in all provinces and regions to inform policy development and strategic programmatic interventions in support of eradicating the economic exploitation of children. The research methodology and survey sample finalization and pilot testing concluded in all provinces enabled field-level survey implementation together with budget allocation commitments from the Government. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: No. of policies on violence or exploitation, aligned with applicable international minimum standards, available/endorsed

baseline.value: 0 No VAC policies, No Child Labour policies

target.value: 2022:Approved policy on economic exploitation for Balochistan, PAK, ICT. Approved policy on VAC for Balochistan. Sindh. KP, Punjab, GB

title.narrative: Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex

baseline.value: 1996 Child Labour Survey; Study on online sexual exploitation of children; No Provincial Child Labour Surveys No VAC studies Baseline: 0

target.value: 2021:CLS completed in Punjab, Sindh, KP, Balochistan, ICT, PAK and GB

actual.value: 2019:Child Labour Survey initiated in Punjab, Sindh, KP, Balochistan, GB, PAK and ICT.

title.narrative: Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex

baseline.value: 1996 Child Labour Survey; Study on online sexual exploitation of children; No Provincial Child Labour Surveys No VAC studies Baseline: 0

target.value: 2021:CLS completed in Punjab, Sindh, KP, Balochistan, ICT, PAK and GB

actual.value: 2019:Data collection completed in GB and started in Punjab.
